io.leonis.math.filter

Class KalmanFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.leonis.math.filter.KalmanFilter

  • public class KalmanFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class KalmanFilter. This class contains the functionality of a Kalman filter for linear applications. The implementation is based off of notes and equations which can be found here.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public Distribution apply(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray stateTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray measurementTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray controlTransitionMatrix,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray controlInputVector,
                          org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray processCovariance,
                          Distribution measurement,
                          Distribution previousState)
        Computes the filtered GaussianDistribution (mean and covariance) using the supplied state-, measurement-, and control-transition matrices, and the supplied control input, process noise, observation noise, and current state.
        Parameters:
        stateTransitionMatrix - The state-transition matrix used in projecting the GaussianDistribution.
        measurementTransitionMatrix - The measurement-transition matrix used in computing the measurement based on the supplied state.
        controlTransitionMatrix - The control-transition matrix used in computing the effect of the control input on the resultant GaussianDistribution.
        controlInputVector - The control input.
        processCovariance - The process variance matrix. This matrix determines the impact of the state transition matrix on the filter and can be seen as an indication of how trustworthy the state transition model is. Lower values in the process covariance matrix result in the filtered state tending towards the projected state using the state transition model. Higher values result in the filtered state tending towards the measurements.
        measurement - The GaussianDistribution of the measurement, where the mean is equal to the measurement vector and the covariance is equal to the measurement variance matrix.
        previousState - The GaussianDistribution of the latest state.
        Returns:
        The filtered state.
